intro: Drimys dipetala, commonly known as the two-petaled drimys, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Winteraceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in temperate rainforests, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, and it produces berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
